The BOY goes directly to a candy shelf and opens a jar, t handful of gum balls and heads for the counter. The title reads ACTION COMICS with a 1930s era SUPE lifting a car above his head and smashing the front end i ground. Enamored by it, the BOY stares and in a DREAMLIKE STATE t CAMERA cuts between BOY, COMIC, and slowly panning in on them. Finally, the BOY looks up at the CLERK who's been p waiting for him. The BOY looks a last time at the book on the shelf, then handful of gum and the other with a single dime. He looks the CLERK who looks like he knows something the boy doesn

CAMERA OVER SHOULDER shows the BOY slowly opening the fro with much delicacy revealing the interior to be a VIBRANT WARNER BROS LOGO (WB Shield on blue clouded sky). CAMERA PANS IN OVER THE SHOULDER and the LOGO fills the s Black and white sequence finished. WE ARE IN THE MOVIE. CAMERA pans upward slowly and the logo slides off the bot the screen, the blue clouded sky merges with the infinite of space. Almost unnoticeable in the far off distance is minuscule green dot. Without warning, the green dot EXPLODES IN A BURST OF SIL LIGHT. Several seconds pass as the shockwave from the exp travels towards us and like a rumble in the distance, bri tidal wave of sound with it. Debris hurls itself in all directions. With it A SMALL SP ZIP towards us, past the explosion and whips overhead. Th tilts and follows the orange and green craft. The planet' fragments follow the craft. The debris loses speed and begins to fall behind the ship the only thing left in frame from the dead planet is the ship hurling through space. BEGIN OPENING CREDIT SEQUENCE. Opening credit sequence is displayed while we follow the through infinite space. On occasion, the ship radically c direction like it knows where it's going. Its destination accident. The ship enters our solar system and barrels past familia planets. In the distance is Earth. The ship cracks through Earth's atmosphere and its hull i in a bright red flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXTREME CLOSE-UP of a mittened hand holding a misshapen r JONATHAN KENT, a Kansas farmer in his thirties, is holdin nail. Standing in from of him is his wife MARTHA (also in thirties) with a look is irritation. In the background is weathered 1954 pickup truck with a flat tire. There is vi no light on this country road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now, Jonathan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONATHAN's face bends with an "I don't need this" smirk. night lights almost like day and there is a tremendous cr the ship breaks the sound barrier. In the background, the flaming craft crashes into a field a charred crevice several hundred feet long and a trail o steaming melted snow. JONATHAN and MARTHA, in total disbelief, slowly move towa wreckage as if they are unconsciously drawn to it. In the background is the distant cry of a baby. ROCKET POV, JONATHAN and MARTHA peer into the crater with confusion and then turn to each other for an explanation of them has. They simultaneously look at the rocket then sky. The CAMERA looks upward with them and keeps going un there is nothing but space. END OPENING CREDIT SEQUENCE ON NIGHT SKY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA pans down from space through the clouds and me with a beautiful blue sky, which is disrupted by a massiv shaped state-of-the-art skyscraper made of steel and glas roof is slanted to make the "L" visible in the distance. CAMERA keeps moving down the building for what seems like and finally other buildings appear along the skyline, but obvious this is "the" building in the city. A landmark li other and everything else pales on comparison. The city in the background bustles with life. She is like other on Earth. She is immaculately clean and meticulousl engineered. Skyscrapers are everywhere but the city doesn cluttered. Ten million people call her home and with the multilayered highways, subways and elevated trains it nev congested. She is the most advanced city in the world, th template for all others. Her name is appropriate; this is Metropolis. Still moving down building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still moving down building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still moving... The CAMERA nears the bottom panning down huge letters etc stone on the building side boldly announcing LEXCORP (and it corporation's slogan "Bringing The Future To You Today Finally we reach the bottom of the building and pedestria into view and the pan ends on the back of a young, business-suited woman staring up at the menacing tower. S nervously gathers herself, builds her confidence and ente

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOMAN enters the lobby. There are dozens of people bustli about. She approaches one of a two dozen receptionists be massive marble counter all of whom are all assisting othe RECEPTIONIST she has chosen is finishing up a telephone c her headset/telephone. Several receptionists down is anot woman who appears to be arguing with a receptionist and w someone on her cell phone at the same time, although the can't be heard. The woman is dressed in a suit carrying a briefcase. She looks like she is about to explode. RECEPTIONIST #1 (Finishing her call) Hello. Welcome to LexCorp. May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Startled) I'm here to see Mister Luthor. RECEPTIONIST #1 And what time is your appointment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have an appointment. RECEPTIONIST #1 (disappointed) Oh. I'm sorry. Mister Luthor only sees guests by appointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very urgent. A matter of life and death. RECEPTIONIST #1 (sympathetic) Let me see if I can fit you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RECEPTIONIST #1 begins checking appointments in the compu the arguing woman hears this and flips out. She barges pa several people between them, pushing them out of the way to the sympathetic RECEPTIONIST. The woman is LOIS LANE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) What?! I have been waiting here for three hours and I have an appointment! (Beat) Does he know Lois Lane from the Daily Planet is here? RECEPTIONIST #2 (Under her breath) That's probably why he's not coming down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOIS shoots her a nasty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To RECEPTIONIST #2) The parking garage. You and me, sister. I hope your medical is all paid up. RECEPTIONIST #1 (to WOMAN and ignoring LOIS) I can fit you in Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have to wait until next Tuesday? RECEPTIONIST #1 (apologetic) Tuesday the twenty-third...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's three weeks from now. RECEPTIONIST #1 (Slightly embarrassed) ...in September.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman looks blankly at her examining her options. RECEPTIONIST #2 (calling) Miss Lane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOIS returns to RECEPTIONIST #2. RECEPTIONIST #1 If you have a business card or something, I'd be happy to leave it for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shakes off her daze) No. I don't have anything. (long beat, building nerve) Oh wait, I do have this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RECEPTIONIST #1 stands to retrieve her card and WOMAN ope jacket revealing a bomb strapped around her mid-section. RECEPTIONIST #1 swoons and faints. LOIS, on her cell phon background...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns her back to the woman and starts punching butto frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building is one of the oldest structures in the city brick walls and the newspaper's logo, the Earth with a ro ring that reads DAILY PLANET, on it's roof. The structure testament to the days of journalism before faxes and Inte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a large window, a staff meeting can be seen. Standing at the front of a large table is Daily Planet Ed PERRY WHITE. A large and foreboding pitbull of a man. His trademark unbuttoned collar and open vest give the appear this has been very hard day when in fact, this is every d his fist is an unlit cigar he points at people accenting sentences. He paces when he walks and doesn't speak words as he barks them. Through the glass, his booming voice is muffled. PERRY has two tones: LOUD and LOUDER. Among the staff are CAT GRANT (Society columnist, early 3 very beautiful), RON TROUPE (Sports, an African American 40s) and mild-mannered CLARK KENT (City Columnist). KENT his early 30s and very handsome, although he doesn't know is someone that's above that. Seated at KENT's desk is and watching them through the gl JIMMY OLSEN, photographer. He is sixteen years old and ve bored. With him is ALI, who is flipping through some of h photos with awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Amazed) Look at these Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I took them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know guys who've been taking pictures for fifteen years and aren't this good. jimmy Yeah. The Chief says it's a gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A telephone rings and OLSEN looks around to make sure the no other witnesses and answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daily Planet, Kent speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incoherent yelling can be heard from the other end and OL bullets to attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Miss Lane. They're in a meeting. Sure thing, Miss Lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLSEN scrambles to find a pen, jots down instructions on and hangs up. He fumbles out of his chair and races for t Conference Room throwing the door open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Has lost contact with the Constitution--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIEF! -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLSEN! What they hell are you doing in my staff meeting?! You're not a writer, you're a photographer and you're barely that! Get out of here before I have you selling papers on the corner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instinctively, JIMMY folds and turns to quickly exit, the remembering why he came in the first place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Miss Lane called. Somebody has a bomb in the LexCorp building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't Lois interviewing Luthor today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one has an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) Well what are you waiting for?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone hustles out of the room. As they are leaving, no notices a glass of water and an empty chair where CLARK w sitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are walking the halls performing their duties when of wind and a blur streaks past causing some to look twic finding nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a supply closet, a JANITOR ducks around a corner to sn cigarette. He takes a drag and opens a window to exhale w blur of wind blows past him and out the window knocking s cleaning supplies off the shelves. The JANITOR looks. JANITOR Windy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes another drag on his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are in their apartments as the red and blue blur s by the windows. It moves so quickly that some don't notic Others run to the windows and fire escapes calling their to catch a glimpse of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets bustle with mid-day activity. A GIRL moving w crowd across an intersection stops in the middle of the s An oncoming taxi screeches to a halt to avoid killing her GIRL is staring skyward down the street. Cars horns blare and the TAXI DRIVER leans out and scream TAXI DRIVER Hey stupid! What the-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TAXI DRIVER sees what she is focusing on and forgets was yelling for. Everyone in the street stops and stares. noise of a city in mid-afternoon comes to a silence. In t distance the blue and red streak flies off and makes an a perfect ninety degree turn around a building. People can seen in awe for blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The serenity of the previous scene is interrupted by pani People are fleeing the building being ushered to safety b Metropolis Bomb Squad. The media has arrived, trying to f their way past the POLICE barricades with no luck. There is chatter among the crowd until they realize LUTHO among them and all their frustrations and fears change to silent hush. Surrounded by bodyguards, is LEX LUTHOR. LUTHOR is a midd imposing figure. An angel to some, devil to others. An egomaniacal recluse. A genius. An idiot. A humanitarian a exploiter. He is dressed in a dark business suit that cos to clean than most people make in a month. The look on hi isn't one of fear that would be associated with an assass attempt. To him, this is an annoyance. Leading the team of bodyguards with the LUTHOR center is GRAVES, Luthor's Minister of Security. She is young, peti a short brown male haircut and dressed in a modified vers traditional chauffeur's uniform with a more militaristic She is LUTHOR's personal bodyguard and right hand woman. looks harmless... she isn't. An EMPLOYEE is arguing with a COP when LUTHOR is ushered Their conversation stops and they gawk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that him? EMPLOYEE I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so? EMPLOYEE I've worked here for six years and I've never actually seen the guy before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR is brought directly to the BOMB SQUAD SERGEANT (PENNINGTON).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) SERGEANT, I trust this won't take long. I am trying to run a company. SERGEANT Well, there is a bomb in your building, Mister Luthor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they really wanted to kill me and were remotely competent, I'd be dead by now. I can't stand incompetence. I'd like this matter finished as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOMB SQUAD COP approaches. BOMB SQUAD COP Security gives us the go-ahead. The building is clear, sir. SERGEANT Good. We conduct a floor-by-floor building search in two-man parties for the bomber and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamantly) No! LexCorp is a secured facility. I can't have you traipsing through- SERGEANT How are my men supposed to find the-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are sensitive materials and projects- SERGEANT With all due respect, there is a bomb in there that could level this building-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll build a new one. SERGEANT And what about your EMPLOYEEs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning into SERGEANT) Then I'll hire new ones. (Beat) Regardless, your men will not be entering this facility. (to MERCY) Mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mister Luthor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are your men capable of finding a bomb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mister Luthor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get it done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mister Luthor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MERCY turns and whispers Secret Service-style microphone cuff. SERGEANT This is not standard procedure, Luthor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) As far as I know you're an industrial spy and sent the bomb yourself to get into my building with no witnesses-- SERGEANT (furious) Are you accusing me of not doing my job!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have pens that cost more than you make in a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two begin to argue when BYSTANDER #1 in the backgroun up and points. BYSTANDER #1 Look! Up in the sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several others look. BYSTANDER #2 It's a bird...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The focus shifts from LUTHOR to the sky. BYSTANDER #3 It's a plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whisper builds through the crowd. SUPERMAN gracefully descends to Earth, his red boots gent connecting with the pavement as his red flowing cape casc his shoulders and perfectly hangs from his frame. He land clear side of the barricade. He is a muscular man, 6'3" and 225 pounds. His ice blue e jet black hair compliment his chiseled features. The red yellow "S" shield covers his entire chest. He has a prese unlike any other. LUTHOR is still ranting as the SERGEANT notices him and s arguing. SERGEANT Superman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN stares at the building like he's looking through because he is. SERGEANT leaves LUTHOR who isn't used to being walked awa in mid-sentence. SERGEANT approaches SUPERMAN who is concentrating on his invisible x-ray vision. SERGEANT (slightly nervous) Sir, I'm SERGEANT Pennington of the MPF Bomb Unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN stops scanning and shakes SERGEANT's hand. SUPERMAN Nice to meet you, SERGEANT Pennington. There's no bomb in this building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) How could you know that? SUPERMAN I checked. There are some lead lined rooms which isn't unusual in a research facility but they're secured areas. So unless Luthor put the bomb there himself, the bomb is out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? How dare you insinuate-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN motions to LUTHOR to be quiet. SUPERMAN ("listening") Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear your mother calling you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN "listens" to the crowd. We hear what he hears. W sounds like a massive chaotic bass-heavy thumping narrows shorter and shorter until there is one incredibly quick heartbeat. SUPERMAN stares into the crowd looking "through" them. Th parts as if they know he isn't looking at them until the from the receptionist desk is left standing alone. Her fa full of tears and she looks like hell. SUPERMAN (to LUTHOR) Ex-wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly. I pay the six of them enough money not to try a stunt like this. She's a former EMPLOYEE I had to transfer to a "less desirable position."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) All I wanted was to talk to you, Mister Luthor. You told me you cared and I just want one more chance. I just wanted to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have an appointment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furiously the WOMAN pulls a trigger from her pocket and r jacket open showing the bomb. Immediately, SUPERMAN begin inspect it with his telescopic vision. SERGEANT Hey lady! I don't know what this schmuck did to you but you're gonna kill a lot of innocent people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MERCY leans into LUTHOR and whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Cheryl, I know there may have been some misunderstandings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transferring me to Bludhaven is hardly a misunderstanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about I'll have someone give you a call if you leave your number with-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'LL GIVE YOU A NUMBER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People begin to scramble from the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can give you a promotion. Maybe move you into a nice office on the one-hundred and fourth next to the Executive Wash Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People begin to knock each other over fleeing the area. T POLICE are right behind them. People take shelter behind structures. SUPERMAN is watching her, totally calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred percent salary increase. That oughta buy a lot of therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She presses the trigger and there is an almost inaudible She presses repeatedly and nothing. She looks at the trig in its place is a sterling silver pen. She clicks it agai the point extends and retracts. She looks down at her mid and there is no bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR, SUPERMAN and SERGEANT. They are confused except for SUPERMAN who no one notices holding and inspecting the bomb. SUPERMAN Where did you get this? This is very impressive. (To SERGEANT) What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERGEANT does a double take and then inspects it without it. SERGEANT That is impressive. That is your basic Class Six explosive with a chemical balance and wire trigger. It's a common weapon used by American Militias and Querac Jihads. (Beat) You disarm it by cutting the yellow, the pink and then the black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN's irises turn red and three wires burn clean thr hands it to SERGEANT who just stares at him in amazement. Two OFFICERS arrest the WOMAN. As she's being taken away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheryl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns with hope in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you're fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaks free of the POLICE and lunges at LUTHOR. Stepp the way of her charge is MERCY. With a martial arts move appears to be one fluid motion, she drops her to the grou POLICE gather her and take her away. SERGEANT Superman, how did you know where the bomb was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Answering for SUPERMAN) A heartbeat has a particular rhythm that's corrupted when someone is under duress, a threatening situation or lying. SERGEANT Like a polygraph. SUPERMAN Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a neat trick. Do you do parties? SUPERMAN It's not so easy to distinguish when there are two heartbeats, Luthor. (giving LUTHOR a very dirty look) If that's all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOIS LANE runs to the scene as SUPERMAN is preparing to l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not done with you yet. You committed an extreme invasion of my privacy by looking into my building. You can expect to hear from my lawyers. SUPERMAN I don't have time for this, Luthor. (noticing LOIS) Hello, Miss Lane. How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly nervous) Fine. SUPERMAN It's good to see you again but I have to be going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN effortlessly rises and disappears into the after sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shouting) When I have you brought up on charges and arrested and you'll have all the time in the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sport utility truck drives up the long dirt road leadin KENT farm. The modern truck clashes against the 1950s Nor Rockwell-ish landscape. The door opens and out steps LANA (early 30s) carrying a covered dish. She is dressed in a shirt and worn jeans with very little makeup. The screen door opens and out steps MARTHA KENT, the same we saw for a moment thirty years earlier. Her hair has gr she's found some wrinkles. She is wearing an apron but th isn't a stain on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Scolding) Lana Lang you know better than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTHA rushes to her side like she's a long lost child re home. She kisses her on the cheek and takes the dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Kent we go through this every Sunday. Is Clark here yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I think he said something about a meeting today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONATHAN KENT meets them on the porch. JONATHAN My girl Lana, what did you bring me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTHA rolls her eyes at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scolding) Jonathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peach cobbler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan, what time is Clark coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONATHAN looks at his watch. JONATHAN Well Metropolis time is two hours behind but he's never been late for a Sunday supper. I reckon he should be here-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of their dog barking distracts JONATHAN. He loo the barn and sees their son, SUPERMAN's alter-ego, CLARK playing with the dog. He is dressed in jeans and simple b shirt. JONATHAN --Right on time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Pa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hugs his father who looks small in his arms. Almost bo he approaches Lana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Clark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a shared moment between them. MARTHA whispers to JONATHAN and they leave the two alone moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supper is finished and the table is cluttered with dirty MARTHA begins collecting dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You outdid yourself, Ma. Let me help you with those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK gets up and assists. JONATHAN unbuckles his belt an back in his chair fully satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan, is that necessary. We have guests. JONATHAN What? Lana might as well be family. She can unbuckle her pants if it makes her feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe next time. JONATHAN Are you sure? I'm gonna stretch out on the floor in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK walks out of the house followed by JONATHAN. There marvelous Kansas sunset over the flatlands of the farm. JONATHAN Isn't that something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure is. You know, Metropolis has a beautiful sunset. JONATHAN But you can only see it when you're in a plane above the city. That's why I don't go there often. I think I'd miss her too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma seems a little distant. JONATHAN We saw what you did this afternoon, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. JONATHAN You know how she worries. She just wants you to be safe. You're her only son. Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be careful, Pa. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses his father on the forehead. MARTHA comes out of house with LANA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't going to race off with mine, were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a long hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have some leftovers I can wrap for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm, homemade meat loaf, that's tempting but I'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to walk me to my car, Clark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for having me, Mrs Kent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime, Lana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARTHA and JONATHAN return to the house. CLARK walks LANA slowly to her truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They love you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I don't know what I would do without them. (Beat) You know, when I fly through Metropolis I notice different things all the time. Subtle changes nobody probably notices. But when I fly over Smallville, it's like nothing ever changes. It's just the way I left it. It's like time doesn't work here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing to herself) It works. It just works very slowly. (beat, very serious) I miss you, Clark. I miss you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you, too, Lana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LANA looks at him realizing he doesn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really don't know, do you? You can hear clouds collide into each other but you are so oblivious sometimes. (Beat) You know every time your parents see you on TV they are so proud and so terrified at the same time. When other people worry if their kids are making friends and eating right your parents are worrying if some super-powered goon is going to get the best of you. If you're going to be trapped in space or buried in a lava flow or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat) I had that lava flow under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're missing the point, Clark. They love you and worry about you. I worry about you. Sometimes I wish you would just come home one Sunday for dinner and stay but I know that can't happen. I've known you since we were kids and I know how your parents raised you. You could never stay in Smallville knowing there were things happening in the world you could prevent. You couldn't live with yourself. You could never be that selfish. (Beat) But I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, there are ten million people in Metropolis and I don't know any of them. Sometimes I think about it and I'm saving a city full of strangers when the people I know and love are here. And the worse part is everyone there thinks they know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there things actually happen. They need you more than we ever could. They depend on you. You're their hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I? NASA lost contact with the Constitution and on reentry it exploded and twelve men died. I might have been the only man on Earth who could have saved them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you didn't, Clark. You didn't save them and they died. You can't save them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead, I spent my afternoon saving the life of a billionaire egomaniac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if you hadn't? What if that woman blew up the building and a few thousand people died? Clark, you can't be everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if I had been-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you had been what? Two places in the same time? Stronger? Faster? You may be the most amazing person on the planet and the world may call you Superman but inside you're just a man. You have to accept that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK reaches over and holds her hand. She smiles and lea and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember that night after graduation when you took me out into the back field. I knew you were going off to college but somewhere, I thought you were going to ask me to marry you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK has a look of surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we would get married and you'd get me out of the one cow town and I'd actually see something in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana, I didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LANA shushes him before he can finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have married you when I had the chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll always have the chance, Clark. Whenever you're ready to come home, I'll be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both gaze up into the open Kansas sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the room seated around a large marble table are thirty from various divisions of the LexCorp empire. One entire a window overlooking a breathtaking view of night-lit Met The massive seat at the front of the table is empty. The two giant doors to the room are tossed open and in wa LUTHOR (everyone stands). As always, within arms distance MERCY, followed by two SECRETARIES. He sits at the front table with a SECRETARY on each side. MERCY stands behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I've had a hell of a day and I am not in a very good mood so let's make this short. (calling out) Accounting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VAN HYNING, the Accounting Rep stands and clears his thro VAN HYNING We have acquired six more research facilities in Southeast Asia. The munitions plant in Northern Europe that has been prohibiting our use of their new patented circuit board is no longer a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the merger went well? VAN HYNING The details are in my report. LexAir, LexOil, LexCom and their subsidiaries are all doing well, twenty-two percent above the projected goals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) That's what I like to hear! VAN HYNING (nervous) The stock divided this morning and LexCorp took a two hundred point seven million dollar loss... the lowest percentage loss of all the listed companies. A loss sixteen percent higher than Maxwell Lord's holdings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR doesn't look happy with the news and everyone wait his reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly am I standing in? VAN HYNING Company assets are at four point two trillion dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long beat) That's acceptable. (Beat) Research?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLISTER, the rep from RESEARCH & DEVELOPMENT stands. HOLLISTER Construction of our new facilities in South America and Greenland are proceeding ahead of schedule. The great news is medical research has perfected the Leukemia vaccine prototype. It works flawlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have they sent the conditions to the pharmaceutical firms? HOLLISTER Yes they have and they've all declined. They argue the asking price is outrageous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it were their kids let's see how outrageous it is. Very well, we keep it and it goes no where. The Antarctica facility? HOLLISTER Running totally on your new energy source for eight months on a less than a quarter of a percent what it previously used. The new fuel is clean, stable and most importantly cheap. Of course, we only have limited resources.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it possible to replicate the chemical structure? HOLLISTER We know it isn't from Earth but it's being worked on as we speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the Metropolis Energy Commission? HOLLISTER That news isn't as good. There needs to be a unanimous vote to change the city's power source. We own ten of the twelve commission members but the other two refuse to cooperate. They think it's unnecessary to spend billions of dollars of taxpayer's money on an untested source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cloning? HOLLISTER We have a cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cloned a cat? (to VAN HYNING) How much money have I spent on this cloning thing? VAN HYNING Two billion, Mister Luthor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two billion dollars and you have a cat? HOLLISTER Well, we have fifteen hundred cats. (LUTHOR gives him a horrid look) It's very remarkable. They all are identical when means the matrix-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen hundred cats? What am I supposed to do with fifteen hundred cats? If I were in Korea I'd open a delicatessen but I'm not. I'm in Metropolis where fifteen hundred cats are useless to me. I want something better. Dogs, monkeys, French-speaking gorillas. Impress me. HOLLISTER Yes, Mister Luthor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing tone and becoming extremely serious) Now to my Legal Department... I have a problem, which in turn means you have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR stands and begins circling the table in a tiger-li looking for something to kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This afternoon a man stood outside, on my property and looked inside my building. My business. My home. I consider this a grave invasion of my privacy. (Beat) Now what are you going to do about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several attorneys look nervously at each other. LUTHOR po WYNN, a young man, who returns a "who me" look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's Superman, sir. He's not the kind of person you issue subpoenas to. And he was acting with the cooperation of the Police and under The Good Samaritan act of 1968 you can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire room cringes. LUTHOR looks up with a frighteni serene expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very nervous) You can't take legal action-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wynn, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Wynn, how long have you been employed here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three months, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And can you tell me what qualifies you to work in my Legal Department?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I attended Harvard Law School on a full scholarship and graduated in the top three percent with honors. I worked as a public defender for three years in Gateway City with an undefeated record. I had my own firm for two years in Keystone and decided I wanted to work with the best and came here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you familiar with my qualifications?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let me familiarize you with my resume. I completed high school when I was fourteen. I had my first Bachelor's Degree when I was sixteen. My first doctorate when I was seventeen. I have four of them. I graduated in the top three of my class because I was too busy working on theories for matter destabilization that year but I did manage a Nobel Prize nomination in science but I lost to some Mathematician with theories no one will ever use. NASA paid me for the destablizer and I was a millionaire at twenty-four. I made my first billion when I was thirty-one. (to VAN HYNING) What are my personal assets? VAN HYNING As of four-fifteen this afternoon, your personal worth is one hundred and sixteen point one billion dollars... give or take a few hundred million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of the other two, one is an advisor to the President and the other spends his nights praying he can defend WayneTECH from my corporate raiders. (Beat) I understand you're new but for future reference, you never tell me what I can and cannot do. (Beat) VAN HYNING. VAN HYNING Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superman said something about not being able to see through the lead-lined rooms in the radiation labs. Get an estimate to the interior walls painted with a lead content paint. (Turns toward the window) I'm thinking... beige.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR is staring out over the city. Everyone exits except MERCY. LUTHOR reaches adjusts his j and realizes he's missing his sterling silver pen. He loo MERCY for an answer and she shrugs her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOIS enters PERRY's office waiving a floppy disk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drops the disk on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The story on LexCorp bomb for the morning edition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERRY holds up another disk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark had his here before he left at seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOIS doesn't say anything. She fumes until she's built up pressure she storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting out and holding the disks) And what ever happened to paper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOIS drops into her chair, consumed with anger. The clock background reads 11:00PM. Cleaning people come and go along with the occasional wor burning the midnight oil. She never moves but the time do The clock DISSOLVES to 8:30am. The office becomes alive w people. CLARK KENT enters with RON TROUPE and they go to their re desks. CLARK situates his things, opens the morning paper LOIS glares at him the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (monotone) How do you do it, Smallville?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not lowering the paper) Do what, Lois?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowering the paper and looking up) I'm just doing my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Getting the stories on the front page is what I do. You're doing my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you jealous, Lois?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I am not jealous of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what. I have a meeting with MAYOR Berkowicz to discuss the revamping of the transit system. Why don't you go instead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do me any favors. Sam Lane didn't raise his daughters to take hand-outs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I insist. I have a friend coming to town and it'll free up more of my time. He likes you better anyway. You always get the good stuff out of him. (convincing) Come on, Lois. He owes me an interview as a favor. It'll be an exclusive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitant) Okay, I'll do it, but not because I want the story. I'm doing it so you can spend the evening with your friend to do whatever it is you do when you're not here. Understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're helping me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the room RON and JIMMY are listening in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lois is one hard case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Lane hates to lose... especially to Mister Kent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'd hate to be on the receiving end of that but I think Kent actually likes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RON walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A speeding VAN is weaving DANGEROUSLY through traffic whi pursued by POLICE cars. The VAN loses its pursuers but SW avoid a civilian, causing the VAN to flip several times l in the middle of an intersection. Dazed, three ski-masked THUGS emerge carrying duffel bags money. THUG #1 Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They flee through the streets, past pedestrians and into subway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THUGS jump the turnstile and FORCE THEMSELVES Into a train as the doors shut and it pulls from the platform. S patrons scream with terror. THUG #2 Everybody shut up or somebody's gettin' a bullet in the head! THUG #1 (to THUG #3) Go up front and make sure the driver doesn't radio anybody or make any stops until I say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUG #3 hustles to the front of the car. THUG #1 (to THUG #2) They can still stop the car from the central station so if we don't stop at the 147th then they don't know what car we're on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train approaches the next platform without slowing. THUG #3 (excited) We're not slowing! They don't know which train we're on! We are outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THUGS rejoice in a quick celebration as the train spe the platform. On the platform is CLARK KENT next to LOIS (with her cell phone.) The waiting commuters are confused and start mumbling. In instant, CLARK peers into the moving train with his teles vision sees the THUGS with their hostages. CLARK takes two steps backwards behind the line of people gray hat can be seen above the headline as he moves along platform in the direction of the train. Between the peopl see a blur that changes from a gray suit to the familiar uniform. He emerges from the other side as SUPERMAN and f into the tunnel. He's gone in a blur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN speeds through the darkened tunnel, his image is flicker among the passing subway lights. As he approaches train he turns sideways (left side down, his front to the and squeezes BETWEEN THE TRAIN AND SUBWAY WALL. His face as he builds speed and MATCHES the turns without slowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HOSTAGES in the train are panicked. One HOSTAGE, faci window, can see a large sideways "S" shield moving past t the front of the train. HOSTAGE burps a small nervous lau another until they quickly build to a frenzy of uncontrol laughter. The other HOSTAGES fear he's going to get them THUG #2 (to LAUGHING HOSTAGE) What the hell is so damn funny? laughing hostage (trying to calm himself) You...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN arrives at the front of the train and turns upri flying in a standing position at the door. LAUGHING HOSTAGE (laugh) ...are gonna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN forces his fingers between the doors and tears t with the sound of twisting metal. LAUGHING HOSTAGE (trying to stop) ...get your ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN, hovering two feet above the floor, steps down i LAUGHING HOSTAGE (laughing) ...so kicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYBODY in the train looks at the LAUGHING HOSTAGE with what he's talking about. SUPERMAN (OS) Gentlemen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUGS turn to see SUPERMAN. Immediately they point their fire in a rapid succession of bullets. Barely moving, SUP whips his hands through the air catching dozens of bullet THUG #2's gun jams. THUG #1 runs out of ammunition. THUG #3 keeps firing and SUPERMAN, still catching bullets slowly toward him, reaches out, wraps his fingers around and begins to "crinkle" it causing it to SMOKE AND break Metal chunks clang as they hit the floor. After the last falls, SUPERMAN laces his fingers with the THUG's and squ causing the THUG to buckle to his knees screaming in pain SUPERMAN (to THUG) I'm guessing you're new here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUG #2's gun unjams and he fires at SUPERMAN's back. SUP hears the shot and turns. The bullet hits him square in h and ricochets... POV - the bullet: speeds back to THUG #2's forehead. THUG the bullet closes in on his face, it stops in mid-air. CAMERA pans out and SUPERMAN is holding the bullet betwee thumb and index finger, four inches from THUG #2's forehe bullet is wafting smoke. THUG #2 is whimpering. SUPERMAN I think this belongs to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the hot bullet in THUG #2's palm and closes his f around it. The train comes to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are emergency vehicles and POLICE waiting streetsid SUPERMAN emerges from the subway surrounded by the crowd people he's rescued. A little GIRL approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superman, can I get my picture taken with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're from out of town and it would be a great souvenir. SUPERMAN I really don't do pictures... but I'll tell you what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN holds out his hand still full of bullets. He kne the girl's level and blows on them. The little GIRL wince cold air. When the mist clears, the bullets are incased i SUPERMAN plucks one from the mounds and hands it to her. SUPERMAN Why don't you take one of these and tell all your friends you saw Superman catch it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN sets the frozen bullets on the ground and the cr scrambles for them. SUPERMAN sees LOIS off to the side jo notes on a tablet furiously. The GIRL takes the frozen bullet and gleefully shows her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Superman. SUPERMAN My pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN shakes his hand and winces. FATHER looks at him LOIS notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see that. SUPERMAN I'm fine, Lois.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOIS opens his hand and his palm is burned. LOIS looks at with fear in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this from the bullets? SUPERMAN I'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flies off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several COPS are escorting a HUGE LOUD PERP through the b station into lockup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey pigs, how long you think I'm gonna to stay here before I breaks loose and kill you all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMALL FEMALE COP (OFFICER WARREN) walks by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey piglet, nice piece you got there. You wanna see what I'm packin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out a can of mace and sprays him directly in th He starts coughs and changes into a laugh. He repulses her by flicking his tongue. He holds his cuff in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like to play with handcuffs as much as I do? OFFICER WARREN I prefer my men without jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He twists his ham-fists together and strains the small si chain until it breaks. He holds his free hands in the air

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm flexible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks her up (OFFICER WARREN screams) and tosses her a the room like a discarded toy. The station goes berserk. POLICE scramble for cover and d their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, who wants to be first?! STRANGER (OS) That would be me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole sequence is done without a visual of the STRAN is to be revealed later. PERP looks down and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERP is thrown through the front double glass doors and l the middle of the street. Dazed, he lifts himself to see headed straight for him. He SCREAMS! The DRIVER slams his breaks and the truck ski At the last possible second, a hand presses into the truc and stops it. The airbag ignites and explodes on the DRIV front of the car is smashed like it hit a tree. STRANGER (OS) To POLICE) Someone see if that driver is okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police Station empties into the street. The PERP is m to himself. The STRANGER grabs him by the back of his nec squeezes. He points him into the direction of the OFFICER (who is rubbing her neck). STRANGER (OS) (To PERP) Since I'm sure you don't have a mother, I'll assume you don't know better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you, you frickin'- STRANGER (OS) (squeezing harder) Apologize to the lady. I'm only going to ask you nicely once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in horrible pain and whimpering) I'm sorry, Miss Police Lady Miss. STRANGER (OS) That's better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets go and PERP falls to the ground. CLOSE-UP ON PERP'S HANDS as six pair of handcuffs lock ar wrists and he's led back into the station by several COPS rifles pointed at him. The STRANGER walks down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A school bus has a blow-ouT. The DRIVER tries to keep con it leans and is hit by A TRUCK knocking it on its side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHILDREN are screaming and crying. The DRIVER stagger feet in the overturned bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIDS! KIDS! Everybody stay calm. This is going to be okay. (pointing to an older boy) Patrick! See if you can open the emergency door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATRICK pulls the lever but the door doesn't open. He sti head out a broken window and sees... A FREIGHT TRAIN. They have been pushed through traffic on tracks. PATRICK Mister Clifton! There's a train coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHILDREN begin screaming when something else slams in bus with a THUD!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus starts to slide on the pavement through the train intersection. People get out of their cars watching the s CAMERA pans around the back of the train revealing STRANG his back against the bus PUSHING it over the tracks. The revealed slightly more than he was in the previous scene. The bus barely clears the tracks and the train speeds by. The STRANGER goes to the top of the bus (which is on its and with his bare hands tears into the metal roof making opening for the children to escape. STRANGER Everybody be careful. The edges are sharp. Don't cut yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVER, the last one out, squints at the sun in his e he looks to his silhouetted benefactor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Superm-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And realizes this isn't SUPERMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Embarrassed) I'm sorry. STRANGER Don't worry. It happens all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP: There is a short in the magnet track, which sho sparks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gages begin flashing and the MONORAIL CONDUCTOR frantical to regain control. He clicks his radio on. MONORAIL CONDUCTOR Attention base fourteen! Attention base fourteen! MMT six eight nine zero is runaway! Repeat: MMT six eight nine zero is runaway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monorail barrels through its switch-off. MONORAIL CONDUCTOR (to himself) Oh no. The switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEPUTY MAYOR MICHAEL WALKER is behind a podium fielding q from reporters. Among them is CLARK KENT and JIMMY OLSEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...has no official stand at this time but I'll have an answer for you next week. The last three questions will be Ms Parks, Mr Kent and Mr Knox from the Globe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With increased activities by Superman, does this administration endorse these unsanctioned actions and if it doesn't, how does it plan to police them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAYOR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on CLARK KENT whose attention starts to drift. The MAYOR's voice warbles and with his hearing, he begins to other things. The next lines overlap as if listening to a people talk at once. EAVESDROP #1 ...I had the Szechwan Chicken and Garlic Sauce... EAVESDROP #2 ...how could you do that do me? You know how much I care about you... EAVESDROP #3 ...this behavior cannot be tolerated... EAVESDROP #4 ...has managed to synthesize and patent some new mineral at LexCorp... EAVESDROP #5 ...if you're not doing anything after work I was hoping you might... EAVESDROP #6 ...are a bunch of heathen anyway... EAVESDROP #7 ...can't be trusted... EAVESDROP #8 ...don't know what I would do without... EAVESDROP #9 ...the nine thirty show... EAVESDROP #10 ...because of the gun... EAVESDROP #11 ...is so yummy... EAVESDROP #12 ...aren't really hers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voices get more and more singled out until there is o voice. EAVESDROP #13 ...emergency vehicles stand by for massive collision victims at Monorail Base fourteen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound focuses again on WALKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but is appreciated regardless, Mr Knox. And the last question goes to Kent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attention in the room shifts to an empty chair where was seconds earlier. Nobody saw KENT leave and no one is surprised as OLSEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK scurries around the corner past employees. An eleva being repaired and the doors are wedged open. Two REPAIRM working on the doors. CLARK moves to the elevator in a bl REPAIRMEN turn away as the blur moves between them and dr the darkened shaft. The two REPAIRMEN turn and look at each other and then go the business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK freefalls down the shaft, his body a perfectly rigi His tie wisps above his head and his hair flips in the br he plummets several stories. His eyes are closed enjoying moment. The camera CLOSES IN on his chest. His hands gently take the edges of his buttoned shirt and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lobby elevator is opened and marked off with "OUT OF signs. SUPERMAN flies out of the shaft and through the lobby. So enters and SUPERMAN meets the open door perfectly and fli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECOND MONORAIL is unaware another has lost control and switched tracks. They are heading directly toward each ot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN swerves into view and catches up with RUNAWAY MO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From inside, PASSENGERS look and point at SUPERMAN flying overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN flies in front of the monorail, places himself A the front car and pushes in an attempt to slow it down in The MONORAIL CONDUCTOR can see SUPERMAN through the windo MONORAIL CONDUCTOR Come on, Superman! You can do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second monorail is gaining. SUPERMAN uses his telesco vision and can see the other MONORAIL miles away closing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONDUCTOR is on the radio. CONDUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws a series of switches stopping the monorail. Pas are thrown about as it halts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RUNAWAY MONORAIL is within immediate distance. CLOSE on SUPERMAN's face, which is tightened and strained The MONORAIL frame begins to cave in making an indention SUPERMAN at its center. CLOSE on SUPERMAN's face, which is contorted... The noise stops. All is silent. CAMERA pans back from SUPERMAN's face and reveals a halte MONORAIL with his body pressed against it. He looks like in front of a semi compared to the train. CAMERA pans fur revealing the SECOND MONORAIL maybe two feet in front of The CONDUCTORS stare at him in disbelief. CONDUCTOR Wait till my wife hears this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA moves along side the distance of the RUNAWAY showi relieved passengers through the windows and finally comin end of the train revealing the STRANGER holding the back From a back window, people inside the train have been wat him. The STRANGER lets go and steps out onto the platform tire worn. This is the first time we fully see him in light. H huge and bald with a goatee and dressed in black. In the distance, SUPERMAN staggers out from the train. SUPERMAN and the STRANGER's eyes meet. The train doors op people flood out.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION INTERVIEWS
dialogues.text: All taken from witnesses to the day's events and all in d places. SCHOOL GIRL (nervous) Then the bus flipped over and we all fell and the train was coming but somebody pushed us out the way and he was big and strong and big and he pushed us off the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where he came from but he grabbed that guy and tosses him through the window into traffic like he was nothing. He made him apologize to Leah but I don't know, I might have let the guy get hit by that truck. MONORAIL CONDUCTOR I've seen Superman in action but he looked different today. Like he wasn't all there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interviews are part of:

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCAST
dialogues.text: The show is a daily broadcast with a special segment ever SUPERMAN's daily exploits. The logo in the background is slanted letters that appear to be flying off the screen. The host is ANGELA CHEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metallo. Who is he? What is he? Where did he come from? In the past twenty-four hours, he's been responsible for six different rescues and stopping three crimes in progress. With rumors of Superman's abilities waning, could his timing be better? Here to address the issue of Superman's abilities and limitations is STAR Labs' Chief Science expert, Nobel Prize winner and personal friend of Superman, Professor Emil HAMILTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROFESSOR HAMILTON is a man in his early fifties with gla gray hair and a matching beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor HAMILTON, how accurate are the reports of an "injured" Superman? HAMILTON Since Superman's potential and the origin of his abilities are unknown to us, there is no sure way to tell to what extent he's suffering, if he's suffering at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you will agree Superman is not the Man Of Tomorrow he was last month. HAMILTON I have done more tests on Superman than anyone else has on Earth but the duration of time it took for his powers to deteriorate to their current state, only he knows. I can only imagine the effect having such power and then suddenly have it dissipate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOST gets a message from her earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Hold on. We have a report Metallo just stopped a jewel heist in the downtown financial district. We have a camera there now. Let's see if we can go live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A window appears with a scene of overturned cars on fire several other wrecked vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks, I'm not sure what we're looking at here. There appears to be some fire and property damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JERKY CAMERA pans catching METALLO hoisting a THUG in hand in the air and into the back of a POLICE van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! There's Metallo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA gets closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metallo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Angela Chen with Action Comments. Can we have a few words? METALLO Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite his massive intimidating size and almost threaten appearance, METALLO speaks very articulately and is well-mannered. He is a paradox of himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're abilities obviously dwarf the rest of us. Can you tell us how you became Metallo? METALLO I wish I could but most of it's a blur to me. I remember being in a car accident and rescued by someone on the outskirts of the city. I was almost dead and this man, a scientist, saved my life. Unfortunately the scientist died soon after so there is a lot that's unexplained even to me. I'm not sure what he did to me but I'm just glad to be alive. I feel better now than I ever have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The talk of the town is that if you hadn't assisted Superman with the monorail, hundreds could have died and possibly Superman. Do you believe Superman is weakening? METALLO Stopping that train wasn't easy. I know. Maybe there are some jobs that require more than Superman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your way of saying you plan on replacing Metropolis' Marvel? METALLO Definitely not. Superman is a hero to me as he is everyone in Metropolis, if not the world. Look, Metropolis is a big town. There are eleven million people here and I think there is more than enough room for the both of us. I bet the guy could use a vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forced laughter from CHEN. METALLO Now if you don't mind, I'd like to make sure these guys get taken off and I still have to clean up this mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your time. We have a CALLER. CALLER you're on the air with Professor HAMILTON. CALLER (VO) (very inarticulate) I seen Sooperman in action and I don't believe you guys is writin' his death certificate already and puttin' that Metallo guy on yer shoulders. The guy didn't catch a train for Pete's sake! He's always been there when it mattered. Maybe the guy didn't get enough sleep or he's got some kinda twenty-five hour bug or somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Oh-kay. We have another CALLER with an opposing view. Go CALLER. LUTHOR (VO) You really must develop a better screening process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Lex Luthor? LUTHOR (VO) Yes it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an unexpected pleasure. Metropolis' favorite entrepreneur. Can I call you Lex? LUTHOR (VO) No. (Beat) I agree with Metallo. There is room in Metropolis for two heroes. I think underestimating Metallo may be a grave mistake. To put so much trust in one person can only be dangerous. At least we know Metallo is human unlike Superman who hides his origin. Exactly what do we know about Superman in the few years he's been here. CALLER (VO) I know he can kick your bald ass clear to Otisburg-- LUTHOR (VO) (confused) Otisburg? CALLER (VO) Yeah you- LUTHOR (VO) Otisburg? CALLER (VO) Tell you what Luther... LUTHOR (VO) Lu-thor. CALLER (VO) Dumbass! Why don't you come out of that fancy glass house and you and me can do a little one on one in yer front yard or ain't you got the rocks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I think that will be enough and we'll be back after this commercial break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several staffers are gathered around the wall-mounted tel and break up when the LEXAIR commercial starts. In the background, CLARK is at his desk handwriting a letter. LO seated across from him. JIMMY approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see Metallo on the news? Man, is he something or what? (looking over LOIS' shoulder and pointing) There's a "k" in "panicked."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOIS smacks his hand... HARD. CLARK sneezes. LOIS instinc hands him a box of tissue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK reaches for the box and LOIS draws it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly confused) Mister Kent sneezed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sick, Smallville?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little under the weather. Probably something going around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In June?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen you sick, Clark. I thought they built all you country boys big and strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true, Mister Kent. Wow. You're quick, Miss Lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a reporter, Jimmy. I notice things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAT GRANT shouts from her desk on the other side of the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEDDING RING?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been feeling well. I'm probably best I go home and get some rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAT approaches. CLARK puts his letter in an envelope and to JIMMY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, could you take this down to the mail room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing, Mister Kent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAT takes it from JIMMY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana Lang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A letter? Let me guess your pigeons haven't come back yet? You know, with emails, faxes and if you really want to be a Neanderthal you could always use the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's sweet. I can't remember when the last time somebody wrote something for me. Why can't I meet a nice guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't Bruce Wayne serve you with a restraining order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was four years ago and I am feeling much better now, thank you. (Beat) Any good dirt I should know about, Clark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kent doesn't have any dirt. He's going to go home and make some soup from a Kent recipe that's been in the family for six generations and huddle down with a quilt and Frank Capra movie that would make me wretch. Aren't you, Kent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven generations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you had visitors tonight, Mister Kent. Isn't that why you're letting Miss Lane interview Mayor Berkowicz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A statuesque WOMAN (#2) dressed in a long skirt and conse blouse enters. Her body is that of an athlete. Her legs a die for. Her skin's like porcelain and her thick jet blac hair cascades down her shoulders to the middle of her bac She approaches the RECEPTIONIST (#3) who looks up, startl RECEPTIONIST #3 (startled) Can I help you? WOMAN #2 I'm here to see Clark Kent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man walks by in the background staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmmm. More Kansas farm boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat likes 'em big. It must be all the corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open. Everyone in the elevator is at shoulder h mystery woman. She exits and they stare. As she walks dow hall and a man carrying a computer monitor sees her, drop and it shatters on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERRY WHITE sticks his face out of his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK gets up and heads for PERRY's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you so hard on Clark, Lois?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's jealous because she's LOIS LANE: ACE REPORTER and the story of the century, the coming of SUPERMAN, was swooped right out from underneath her while she was there; by the new guy, the country guy. The nobody who went to college at Hicksville University in Kansas. The nobody who never had a professional gig in his life and not only does he manage to sneak a story pass the great and powerful Lois Lane, he manages to win a Carlin Award in the process... (slowly) On his first... time... out. (Beat, to LOIS) Green doesn't become you, Lois.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WOMAN's image is on a wall of monitors. Five GUARDS a watching her. One signals and two more join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Rant) You want to know what it is? This guy is a Boy Scout. He doesn't smoke. He doesn't drink. He doesn't swear. He calls his parents everyday. If I had to talk to my father everyday I'd kill myself. He's honest. He's trustworthy. He's moral. Every friend he's got he's had since high school and that just isn't normal. The guy says grace before his meals, eats his vegetables first and drinks milk. And that ridiculous hat! Who wears a fedora? (Beat) For Christ's sake, has anyone ever seen him use the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at her like she's a madwoman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him help old lady Hayworth across the street to Berardo's Delicatessen yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is exactly what I mean. Everybody knows old lady Hayworth is a cranky bitch. (Searching for words) He's like some kind of by-the-book moral, excellent worker, great writer, seven-year-old in the body of a linebacker virgin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. You're crazy. I hope your medical is paid for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Standing to exit) No. There is something else to this guy. Things about him we couldn't imagine. Nobody eats that much apple pie. I can't put my finger on it but you'll know when I do. Kent is full of surprises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and is eye level at the chest of the mystery WO CAMERA cuts to a FULL SHOT of the both of them and the wo (5'11" wearing four inch heels) towering over the 5'7" LO WOMAN #2 I was told I could find Clark Kent here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WOMAN speaks in a very distinct accent (similar to Gr Everyone is speechless. WOMAN #2 Clark Kent. He's a reporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More staring. WOMAN #2 This is the City Room, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERRY's door open and he and CLARK exit. CLARK sees his g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Excited) Diana!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hugs her. LOIS stares at them both in disbelief. WOMAN #2 from here on will be known as DIANA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was in the wrong place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have any trouble getting into town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. I have a pretty good sense of direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To everyone) Everyone, this is an old friend, Diana. (Introductions) This is Ron Troupe. Cat Grant our society columnist. Jimmy Olsen our favorite photographer. And this is Lois Lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark's told me a lot about you, Miss Lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get my things and we can go. Have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK leaves and DIANA sits in his chair. Everyone hovers her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Diana...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just... Diana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an ancient history liaison for Marston University in Boston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mostly Greek history and cultures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you from Smallville?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Laughing, leans and whispers) Do I look like I'm from Smallville?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIANA gets up and joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a pleasure meeting you all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likewise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK and DIANA exit. PERRY enters in time to see them le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez, where did Kent find the Amazon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment decor is simple. Lots of photos and memento home, high school football trophies and journalism awards DIANA's looking at the wall of pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one is new. clark (OS) (From the kitchen he looks up at a wall and answers) That's my parents and Lana last Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're such good people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIANA gently runs her finger over the image of PA KENT wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know they sent me a Christmas card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Embarrassed) I told them you didn't celebrate Christmas. You should send them a card when Zeus' birthday comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think Hallmark makes a card for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK steps out from the kitchen with a picnic basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little place I know outside the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK and DIANA are sitting on a large blanket eating by light of a lantern. Although we can't see the background, seem to be in the middle of nowhere with a starlit sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone misses you, Clark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Distant) Really? That means a lot to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem distant. What's troubling you, Clark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That train. I've caught planes in midair. I should have been able to stop that. If Metallo hadn't been there those people would have died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they didn't. Be glad he was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's weird because I felt fine before I got there and then I just felt so tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Comforting) It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Worried) It's not okay. I don't get sick. Do you have any idea what it takes to make me tired? (Beat) There was a minute where I thought I was going to die with those people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIANA's face turns serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever thought you were going to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Uneasy at the idea) I, I've never considered it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither. I swear I was going to get crushed between those trains. There was a minute, not even, a fraction of a second, where something inside told me to get out the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then in a split second I justified it thinking if I saved myself and let those few hundred people die how many more could I save in my lifetime? A few thousand? Tens of thousands? Would letting a few hundred people die be worth saving a few million in the end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
