dialogues.text: But you could never do that. Do you think you could just let some asteroid drop into the middle of downtown and whatever happens, happens. (Beat) That's not like you. I know it's a lot of pressure but you raise the standard. Hal doesn't tell anybody but I can tell he tries to run the League like you would. People strive to be like you and that's a good thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid one day I'm going to fail them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one day you might. But you can't live in fear of that. One day we both might die but it isn't how you die that's important... it's how you lived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice to have someone who understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime, Clark. Anytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a really nice spot. I always wondered why it's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA pans out and reveals they are sitting in the c STONEHENGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TECH is seated behind a large panel of gauges, lights a switches. His feet are propped up on another chair and he leaning backwards in his chair reading copy of NEWSTIME. SUPERVISORS walk past the glass booth and one knocks to g attention. SUPERVISOR (Through the glass) Don't fall asleep in there, Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TECH nods his head in acknowledgment and goes back to his reading. SUPERVISOR #1 (To SUPERVISOR #2) He is such a bookworm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA pans behind him and we see the PLAYBOY hidden behi NEWSTIME. A siren starts to wail. On the panel, lights flare on and TECH drops the magazines. He pulls two massive books from underneath the desk and flops them open reviewing procedu SUPERVISORS burst in immediately taking positions on the and making phone calls. SUPERVISOR #1 What the hell happened?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a core breach in sectors seventeen, five, sixty-six, seventy-five and forty-three. SUPERVISOR #2 Barrier fifteen will reach maximum potential in three minutes. Reserve shields are in place. SUPERVISOR #3 (Holding a telephone) It's Damage Control. They want to know can you contain it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extremely long beat. SUPERVISOR #1 Sound 'em off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suicide Slum Metropolis' only ghetto and bigger than some The buildings are run down tenements with barred windows. cars are old and decrepit with exception if the occasiona gangsta ride that people cross the street to avoid. Unles can protect yourself, you don't walk here at night. On a corner, dozens of youths are hanging out when the si begin to wail. They echo through the night like air raid from World War II. One by one, everything stops. Cars stop moving. Music sto playing. People stop talking. People sleeping wake and lo their windows to see the commotion. Everyone already outs walks to the center of the street where they can get a cl of the nuclear power plant visible in the distance at the the slum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK, shirtless and in sweatpants, is sleeping alone. In back of his head, he can hear muffled voices. His eyes fl beneath his closed lids until the voice becomes clear: VOICE (OS) --has ruptured and reached threatening levels in the Suicide Slum borough of Metropolis-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK shoots upright and darts into the living room where CAMERA centers in on a television tuned to Metropolis' 24 news network WGBS. The volume is almost inaudible making ANCHOR appear to be moving her lips without sound. As the pans back out, CLARK's pajamas are on the floor where he standing. In the background there is an open window with waving from the night air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panic in the streets as people try to evacuate the area. gridlocked and the monorails overrun as people force them inside pressing the already overcrowded cars tighter. A s RIOT has broken out with people looting while others are to escape the slum. In a blur, SUPERMAN passes overhead straight for the powe People stop in their tracks behave themselves reminded th be consequences for their actions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Employees are fleeing when SUPERMAN flies through the ope and over the evacuees. He hits the corners at top speed m virtual 90 degree turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN appears in a room full of harried MEN in radiati containment suits trying unsuccessfully to control the pr SUPERMAN Gentlemen... SUPERVISOR #3 Thank God, you're here, Superman. We've lost control of the fail-safes and the core is ruptured. We'll reach a red zone in less than ten minutes. SUPERMAN What do you need me to do? SUPERVISOR #1 The core functions with Uranium 238 rods surrounded with water-- SUPERMAN --Creating steam which powers turbines creating the electricity. (Beat) I really haven't got time for the science lesson. SUPERVISOR #1 (Stunned) The containment systems and backup systems have gone off-line. SUPERMAN How old is this plant? SUPERVISOR #1 It was built in 1984. SUPERMAN Then I assume you're using Barium and lead shielding to contain the radiation? SUPERVISOR #1 Yes. If you can manually force the fail-safe shields back into place we can control the rupture from here. If not, radioactive steam forces the chamber to depressurize and there are going to be a lot of dead people in this city. SUPERMAN Not tonight. (Leaving) Yell when the shields are in place. I'll be listing for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN enters the core and begins to push the shields i place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are watching his progress on a series of monitors the graphics representing a shield slides into place. SUPERVISOR #3 He's doing it! SUPERVISOR #1 This is amazing! Nobody can survive that much radiation! SUPERVISOR #3 Come on. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few more lights go positive on the monitor and one gets into place and stops. SUPERVISOR #2 What happened? SUPERVISOR #1 Maybe the radiation got to him? SUPERVISOR #2 No. The computer must be malfunctioning from the heat. SUPERVISOR #3 That's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERVISOR #3 panics and hits the panels and nothing chan There is a long silence and nothing. Suddenly the monitor the panels being slid into place. The men cheer. The computer returns to its normal mode. T disaster averted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sirens stop and people begin to cheer and shout SUPER name and praises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three MEN rush to the entrance and two of them pull t vault-like door open as a figure steps from the core. SUPERVISOR Thank God, Superm-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERVISOR stops in mid-sentence. The figure steps into t and it's METALLO. In his arms is SUPERMAN. His face pale limp. His uniform is darkened and tattered.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS TELECASTS
dialogues.text: There is a slow fade in from black with voices becoming c before the image. The following series of telecasts blend each other between scenes of them being watched by people worldwide. ANCHOR #1 ... conflicting reports from around the globe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple watching TV in the morning. The WIFE stops in th of making breakfast to listen. ANCHOR #2 ... of a near-nuclear meltdown in Metropolis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowds of people gather in an airport around a television ANCHOR #3 ... at 3am this morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inmates at Blackgate Maximum Security Prison are quiet in cafeteria... ANCHOR #4 ... sources are unable to clarify the cause of the accident...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Generals gathered at the Pentagon watching of massive scr Astronauts in the space shuttle listen. ANCHOR #5 ... but what is known at this time is Superman appeared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young red-haired woman with glasses in a wheelchair beh several dozen computer monitors in a state-of-the-art inf center. ANCHOR #6 ... and attempted to shut down the reactor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children watching televisions in classrooms. ANCHOR #7 ... other details are sketchy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGELA CHEN and the other members of the WGBS television ANCHOR #8 ... some stating Superman was unable to contain the leakage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUARDS and DOCTORS at Arkham Asylum. ANCHOR #9 ... and was assisted by Metallo, another hero who appeared in Metropolis several weeks ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METROPOLIS MAYOR FRANK BERKOWICZ and DEPUTY MAYOR MICHAEL ANCHOR #1 ... and has since built a very loyal following...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERRY WHITE and other members of the DAILY PLANET listen. ANCHOR #11 ... among these rumors are Metallo rescued a fallen Superman from the destructive core...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEX LUTHOR in his bedroom with a marvelous view of the ci the bed is one of his various BIMBOS filing her nails whi LUTHOR concentrates on the telecast from wall of televisi which combine making a single image. ANCHOR #12 ...and another disturbing piece, that we would like to stress has not been confirmed or denied is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MA and PA KENT holding each other's hands, each filled wi dread. ANCHOR #13 ...Superman is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROFESSOR EMIL HAMILTON is barely awake. He's been workin non-stop and it's taken its toll on him. In the backgroun EKG machine with an extremely slow heartbeat. The pattern beat and catches the next one. The pattern quickens and b irregular. HAMILTON looks up. He grabs the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: WGBS NEWSCAST
dialogues.text: ANCHOR #14 (Listening to his earpiece) ... wait, wait. This just in. SUPERMAN IS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IS ALIVE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEOPLE in the previous scenes REJOICE, as do people world Except LUTHOR who fumes while he can hear his employees c in the halls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN sits upright and peels the monitoring tabs from body. HAMILTON rushes to his side. SUPERMAN (Very weak) How did I get here? HAMILTON They took you to the hospital and broke six needles trying to get a blood sample. They gave up and brought you to me. SUPERMAN Are the people safe? HAMILTON Everyone is fine. Metallo shut the reactor down and saved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN gives him a look of surprise and disgust that he at the same time. SUPERMAN I have to get out of here. HAMILTON Superman, you're very weak. I'd like to run some more tests. SUPERMAN I'm sorry, Professor, but I haven't got time for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN staggers across the room and exits. People stare exits the elevator, a shadow of his former self, and exit front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN moves across the pavement, lifts his hands in th and gently rises into the sky. His movements are concentr not fluid. He is like someone sick trying to accomplish b tasks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LANA is watching the news with her feet curled beneath he clutching a pillow. A tap at the balcony window startles her. Outside is SUPE hovering in the air. He looks much better than he did ear LANA tosses balcony window open and leaps out into SUPERM arms with no concern for her safety. He holds her thirty above the grassy lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said you were dead. SUPERMAN I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gently he floats to the balcony and carries her inside. SUPERMAN Lana, may I stay here with you for awhile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Clark. Is everything all right? SUPERMAN I just need some time away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you came.

dialogues.speaker: MAYORAL TELECAST
dialogues.text: Members of the press are gathered. DEPUTY MAYOR MICHAEL W steps up to the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, MAYOR Frank Berkowicz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAYOR FRANK BERKOWICZ takes his place. BERKOWICZ I appreciate your coming on such short notice. I will try to make this brief. These are the facts: This morning, there was an unidentified malfunction at the Shuster Nuclear Facility. Attempting to stop a possible meltdown, Superman was rendered unconscious. The state of his condition was not known then and is still unclear. Metallo rescued Superman from the nuclear core of the facility and possible death. (Beat) For that we are all grateful. At this time I would like to extend my personal gratitude, as well as that of the great city of Metropolis, to Metallo, for averting disaster and saving our friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double doors in the back of the conference room swing ope METALLO strides down the aisle to the podium. Cameras bar with flashes. He shakes the MAYOR's hand and steps behind podium for a few words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK and LANA are sitting on the sofa watching the broad CLARK is dressed in his normal clothes sans glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel so... incompetent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should stay here... with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The telephone rings and LANA answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On phone) Hello. Yes, I was watching it just now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She mouths "It's your mother," to CLARK. He motions not t her know he's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On phone) Sure, Mrs Kent. I don't know either. Well, you know I will. Okay, give Mr Kent my best. Bye. (Hangs up phone) Arrggghhhh! I hate lying to your mother. I feel so guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows what happened. If she knows I'm here she's not going to want me to go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Disappointed) So I guess this means you aren't staying?

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCAST "ACTION COMMENTS FEATURING SUPERMAN"
dialogues.text: CLOSE on ANGELA CHEN, the host.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to a special edition of Action Comments. I'm your host, Angela Chen. With the near-disaster that took place several days ago, a debate has emerged regarding Metropolis' questionable power source. Our special guest for the hour is Metropolis' other favorite son, millionaire industrialist Lex Luthor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA snaps to a TWO SHOT putting an insulted LUTHOR frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billionaire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Embarrassed) Oh, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A common error.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to give a special thanks to Mister Luthor who not only agreed to this interview, but also permitted us to telecast from one of his soundstages in the LexCorp building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have been happy to join you downtown but in light of recent (ah-hem) incidents, one can never be too careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our pleasure, Mister Luthor. (Beat) Now it's your opinion this whole incident could have been avoided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several months ago my engineers at LexCorp developed a revolutionary energy source. This source is able to produce the same results as a nuclear facility without the ugly side effects the citizens of Metropolis came so close to experiencing first hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without the chance of a hazardous leak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None whatsoever. Our energy source is devised by splitting atomic particles and then harnessing that energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevertheless, if you have eliminated the radioactive side effect, then you aren't splitting uranium or any other radioactive element.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what are you splitting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Angela, if I had a dime for every time someone asked me how I did something I'd be a millionaire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you are a billionaire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You catch on quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reaching to the side and getting a report) This is a report from the Metropolis Energy Commission in which they reviewed your proposal. They objected to your not allowing the energy source to be tested by an outside safety committee or revealing the source of the energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela, you don't look into the face of God and ask him how he makes air. You should just be glad it's there. (Beat) Let it be known there were only two people on that panel that oppose me and refused to move into the twenty first century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there is an issue of price. This energy would cost the citizens of Metropolis three times what they are currently being charged. Do you think this is fair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things cost money. Power plants cost money. Research costs money. Skilled EMPLOYEEs cost money. Your children's safety costs money. People will say it's a lot of money but I can guarantee the people at Love Canal, Three Mile Island and Chernobyl wish they had that option. In fact, I bet there are people in Suicide Slum tonight that would pay for that option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But aren't you afraid people will look at this as a case of the rich getting richer? Don't you have a duty as a human being to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the best for my city, Miss Chen. I'm a business man, let Simon Carr and Ted Kord be philanthropists and humanitarians. I have always thought Metropolis was on the forefront of technology and many of those advancements come from LexCorp. They don't call Metropolis "America's City" for nothing. We are not the standard and never should accept that position. We are the example and if my beloved city refuses to look at the future because of a few extra pennies, then I think it's a sad day in Metropolis. How many more meltdowns do we have to incur before we realize safety is our responsibility and not that of some stranger in his underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! That almost sounded like an attack on Superman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me just thank God for Metallo because without him there would be a few hundred thousand dead people MAYOR Berkowicz would have to account for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, in an opinion poll taken this afternoon, citizens were asked who they would depend on in a crisis and an overwhelming eighty-two percent still said they would side with Superman. I think it may be a little premat--

dialogues.speaker: S M A S H
dialogues.text: The image, revealed to be on a television, dies. Inside t cracked screen is an empty liquor bottle. METALLO (OS) WHAT THE HELL?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO is on a huge sofa with five scantily clad BIMBOS to caress a piece of him. The furnishings in the massive reek of money. The wall-sized windows overlook the nightl Along the floor are liquor bottles and empty plates where has been treated like a king. His demeanor is 180 degrees different than what it was ea He is loud, thuggish and belligerent. BIMBO #1 Oh John, what did you have to go and do that for? That's the third set this week. METALLO I can't stand this crap! Everywhere I go it's Superman save me and Superman you're my hero! How many people do I have to save?! How much of this do I have to put up with?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIMBO #1 can be heard in the background ordering a new television. BIMBO #2 I don't know what that Chen girl likes but I think you're so much sexier than Superman. Capes are so out this year. Besides, everybody knows nice boys finish last, and more importantly, are so bo-ring. BIMBO #3 Come on, John. Let's go in the back and we can take your mind of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nuzzles his neck. BIMBO #2 starts unbuttoning his shi kissing his chest. It makes him uncomfortable. BIMBO #3 Doesn't that feel good? METALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bucks them both onto the floor. METALLO It doesn't feel like anything! I can't feel anything! I can't smell anything! (He kicks a plate of food across the floor) I can't taste anything! And I am sick of being second to that blue idiot! I'm just a shell of a man and I got nothing! (Long Beat) Me and Luthor gotta have a talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO stands up and BIMBO #4 hangs on him. BIMBO #4 Don't go anywhere, Johnny Baby. Stay here with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picks BIMBO #4 up with one hand and tosses her through th onto a sofa. METALLO storms from the room. The BIMBOS all get very ser They aren't as dumb as the pretend and their real purpose keeping METALLO docile. BIMBO #5 picks up the telephone. BIMBO #5 Security? He's out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR and ANGELA CHEN are going to commercial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --after these messages. DIRECTOR (OS) And we're off. Seventy seconds people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAKE-UP people rush the two and touch up the make-up. LUT cell phone rings. He motions the MAKE-UP people away and it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. How long ago? Very well. (Dialing another number) Mercy, he's on his way. Maneuver six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MERCY GRAVES is standing to the side watching the broadca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into a cufflink microphone) Yes, Mister Luthor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four SECURITY GUARDS scramble through the hall to meet ME The elevator door opens revealing the hulking METALLO. SECURITY #1 (To METALLO) Sir, I'm going to have to ask-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO lifts him and throws him THROUGH THE AIR. He hits floor and slides into a wall. He grabs another and lifts him over his head knocking cei tiles down with his feet as he turns and drops him. He takes another and pushes him into a wall denting the p rendering him unconscious. His limp body hangs in the bro plaster for a few seconds and drops. The last GUARD draws his gun and fires into METALLO's bac METALLO turns. The GUARD fires Repeatedly. METALLO Is that the best Luthor's got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO pushes him aside and he slides across the tiles a at the feet of MERCY GRAVES. METALLO walks over the bodies to pass MERCY. She raises h for him to halt. His hulking mass makes her look even smaller than she is. is fury in METALLO's eyes and no fear in MERCY's. MERCY calmly reaches into her pocket, retrieves a small r control with one button. METALLO You gotta be shittin' me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shows it to METALLO, and then presses the button. METALLO lets out a quick scream and is silenced. He doubl and drops to his knees in excruciating pain. LUTHOR's voice is heard through her earpiece. LUTHOR (VO) Mercy, is our guest under control?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mister Luthor. LUTHOR (VO) Good. Prepare him for company. I'll be up in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO is seated in a large metal chair with thick, modi manacles on his wrists and ankles. He's immobile except f neck up. His face strains as he tries to break free. The doors are tossed open and LUTHOR saunters to the bar makes himself a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Corben. I have to say I thought our working relationship up to this point had been quite complimentary. You really must learn how to behave when you're a guest in someone's home. METALLO What have you done to me, Luthor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same thing I do to everyone. (Facing him) I control you. (Beat) Of course with you, it isn't something as easy as slush funds or threatening your family. You're special. I had to have equipment built, satellites to monitor you etcetera etcetera etcetera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR walks over and taps the manacles with a new sterli silver pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't think I was going to spend a few billion dollars to make you the most powerful THUG on Earth just to watch you walk away when you got bored, did you? It's all planning, my boy. That's why I am who I am and you are... (Beat) Well, why you're stuck in that ridiculous chair. METALLO Nobody treats John Corben like a chump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay attention you idiot, I am treating you like a chump because, I don't know if you noticed or not, you are the chump. Without me, you're nothing. METALLO Without you, I'd still be man! I can't feel anything! The heat, the cold, nothing! I can't smell! I can't taste! Everything sounds funny. Nothing looks right. I can't stand this! You've made me into some kind of freak!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Furious) I saved your life! If I hadn't invested in you, you would be a two-bit dead assassin and petty thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR turns to leave. METALLO This isn't over, Luthor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Furious) Is that a threat? METALLO Why don't you call one of your lawyers and have them figure it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better yet, why don't I call my technicians and have them take you apart one piece at a time? (Beat) Bitch bitch bitch. Moan moan moan. You're alive and as jarring as it may be, it still beats the hell out of the alternative... (Beat) ...Which is still an option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Corben, you are alive because I want you that way and when or if I decide otherwise, there is nothing on this planet than can save you. Is that clear? METALLO (Reluctantly) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. Now I'll let you go if you promise to behave and cooperate as agreed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO nods. LUTHOR has the remote MERCY had earlier and switches him "on." METALLO stands and breaks free of the that drop to the floor with a metallic clang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if you'll excuse me, I have business to attend to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR turns before exiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And John, you may be a shell of your former self and you may be my pawn... (Beat) ...but at least you have your health.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR leaves. METALLO, furious, picks up the metal chair tears it in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME LAPSE: METALLO paces the room pondering his situatio METALLO exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO walks the halls with a mission. People cross to g of his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slides open and METALLO enters. The room is cove wall-to-wall state-of-the-art technology. There are sever wandering about manning their stations. One sees METALLO approaches him. TECH #1 Sir, this area is authorized personnel only. (Recognizes him) You're Metallo. METALLO (Polite) Yes, I am. TECH #1 I didn't know you were in the building. METALLO I'm a guest of Mister Luthor. TECH #1 Well it sure is pleasure to meet you, sir. I saw what you did with the chemical fire on the East Side. My brother lives there and it's appreciated. METALLO No problem. I was bored so I've been wandering the building. I just wanted to look around. Is that okay? TECH #1 Sure. We aren't accustomed to having guests but I can give you the nickel tour. METALLO What is all this? TECH #1 This is the Communication Center for LexCorp. From here we keep in contact with the affiliates in Atlanta, New York, Tokyo, Coast City, Sydney, London and another three dozen cities worldwide. Mister Luthor can control information from his own private network as well as the sixty-eight satellites he has in orbit around the planet and on reconnaissance missions through space. METALLO Pretty impressive. TECH #1 State-of-the-art. When NASA and NORAD upgraded they came to Mister Luthor. There isn't another system close to this on Earth. METALLO I guess all this is pretty expensive. TECH #2 Most of it is prototype. Some of it designed by Mister Luthor himself and only he knows the specs. (Whispering) He's something of a paranoid and doesn't like to depend on others for designs. (Beat) Most of it is irreplaceable. METALLO Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO pushes a TECH out of the way, RIPS A 25" MONITOR WALL and lifts it over his head showering him in sparks. TECHS scramble for safety. METALLO Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some TECHS in his way run for cover. METALLO throws the m and destroys a panel of computer banks. TECH #2 Somebody call Mister Luthor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins to trash the room ripping components from the w flipping work stations over. Fires flare and components e A TECH, cowering behind some equipment, reaches out and p button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIREN wails accompanied by FLASHING RED LIGHTS. SECURIT scramble for the COMMUNICATION CENTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SECURITY TEAM passes several intersecting hallways. M GRAVES comes out of one and joins them. METALLO rounds a corner to find MERCY and her men waiting him. She is in the forefront. The TEAM is kneeling with r MERCY is holding out his remote. He pauses. She presses the button. METALLO is still standing. She presses the button again. A look of fear sweeps over her face as METALLO gently tak box from her hands and crushes it in his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quiet) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts MERCY and tosses her. The SECURITY TEAM opens fire riddling METALLO with bullet METALLO charges them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR is in bed with another anonymous BIMBO when the vi rings. Annoyed, he sits and answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SECURITY Mister Luthor, there's been a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of problem? SECURITY You better just come down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR enters what looks like a battlezone. The walls are and riddled with bulletholes. There is a LEXCORP MEDICAL attending to the wounded. Furiously, LUTHOR looks for someone to blame. SECURITY We did the best we could. We barricaded the exits to contain him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SECURITY GUARD points OFF CAMERA and LUTHOR turns as the pans revealing a door-sized hole in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUMPERS BRIDGE is the entrance to SUICIDE SLUM. METALLO w across the desolate bridge, occasionally being passed by vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite the hour, there are people, drug dealers, gangs a hookers wandering the streets. He walks into the center o main strip. Traffic stops around him and comes screeching halt. Horns start to blare and people become irate that h refuses to move. A crowd starts to gather. A car screeches to a halt barely missing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO reaches under the front end of the car and flips landing it on its top. People are too frightened to move but the noise stops. His voice, which starts as a low roar and escalates witho effort. METALLO (Bellowing and building) GET OUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK is getting groceries. The market owner, METCALF, sp CLARK behind the shelves. METCALF Clark? Is that Clark Kent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mister Metcalf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excitedly, he comes around the counter and shakes his han MERCALF I don't think I've seen you since you went off to the big city to be reporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true. You saw me last Christmas. METCALF Then it just feels like forever. You know, I bet we're the only store in all of Kansas that gets the Daily Planet sent in everyday. Granted, it gets here two days late but it's the effort that counts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate that. METCALF Where are your folks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're probably at home. They don't know I'm here. It's kind of a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK hands him some money and METCALF gives him change. METCALF I get it. Mums the word. You take care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK exits and LANA is in her truck listening to the rad singing and tapping the steering wheel like drums. He get passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the radio are SONNY & CHER. LANA is singing along. CLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Singing) ...before it's earned our money's all been spent. (To CLARK) Come on, Clark. (Coaching) "Put your little hand in mine."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Singing badly) Put your little hand in mine. Ain't no hill or mountain, we can't climb. CLARK & LANA (Singing) Babe, I got you, babe. I got you, babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Loosening up) I got you, babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Singing) I got you, babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you've got me, who's got you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LANA laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Singing) I got you, babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls into her driveway. CLARK carries the grocer inside as LANA is still humming the song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK puts the groceries up while LANA turns on the telev Her humming stops. Without being called, CLARK comes out kitchen. On the television is a LIVE broadcast of Metropolis where block has been devastated. Behind the reporter are barric what looks like hundreds of POLICE in riot gear swarming area. In the center of it all is METALLO. REPORTER (VO) ...don't understand. We're a safe distance but that's uncertain since Metallo has been seen to toss various debris, some the size of cars, several blocks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LANA changes the channel and the same scene is shown from helicopter POV. REPORTER (VO) ...just tuning in, Metallo, who only days ago prevented a meltdown and saved hundreds of thousands of lives in Metropolis' Suicide Slum, came in this morning and ordered, repeat ordered, it's citizens to evacuate as he then took over the fifteen square mile project...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She changes the channel again. REPORTER (VO) ...declared Suicide Slum his property and said, and we quote, "whoever wants it can come and get it," and then forced its inhabitants out of their homes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another channel. reporter (VO) ...luckily, most of the people in the area have not returned since the nuclear scare days ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another channel. reporter (VO) ...Berkowicz has called in the Metropolis Special Crimes Unit and is in contact with the Governor requesting National Guard assistance in the absence of Superman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA is close on CLARK's stunned face and then pans revealing LANA looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does it always have to be you, Clark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm the only one who can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK leans in, LANA closes her eyes and he gives her a l passionate kiss. While her eyes are closed, there is a burst of wind throu house that rattles the walls. She opens her eyes to see p shifting on their nails and the front door flung wide ope flapping on its hinges. She runs to the front lawn and looks skyward and he's gon CLARK's POV: On her lawn, she looks tiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shouting) BE CAREFUL, CLARK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The center is in shambles after the METALLO incident. LUT enters and a TECH is immediately at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damage report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metallo destroyed the majority of the Communication nerve center. We've lost contact with seventy-two percent of our affiliates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wasn't he shut down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He managed to destroy enough hardware including our links to LexSats eight, six, fifty-one, forty-seven, five, fifteen and ninety-one including the-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Satellite that monitors activity in Metropolis. He broke his leash. (Beat) I need this online now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a space shuttle preparing for launch from a site in Corto Maltese to regrid the satellites signals to operating stations. They should be ready in fifteen minutes. NASA has been trying to block it as an unauthorized launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NASA can go to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty percent of the hardware should be back online within five hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's your best, your best won't do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we've already doubled our staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Angry) Metallo is tearing up a city block and every COP in the state is about to take a shot at him. I'm not about to have my investment taken out by a bunch of grunts with cheap metal badges! Either this system is online within the hour or you answer to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will triple our efforts, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concrete chunks have been torn out of the street. Cars ar turned on their sides and on fire along with various othe debris. Holes have been punched through buildings leaving insides visible from the street. Scattered along the stre the bodies of fallen POLICE OFFICERS and CITIZENS who got way. Among it all is METALLO. Barely worn and in a frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEOPLE crush into the subway trying to escape the escalat damage above them. Fighting their way through the mass of are LOIS LANE with JIMMY OLSEN in tow. They are the only fighting to get in SUICIDE SLUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jimmy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think this is a good idea, Miss Lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Front seat at the fight of the century is always a good idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nobody's seen Superman in days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that have to do with anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If nobody's seen Superman then who's gonna save us if something goes wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Superman doesn't always save us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he does. Especially you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOIS pauses. She's never considered that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They force their way through the masses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOIS and JIMMY emerge onto the street and find themselves middle of a firefight. LOIS ducks while JIMMY's starts clicking away. The METROPOLIS SPECIAL CRIMES UNIT (SCU) arrives. Six HUMVEE-like RIOT VEHICLES roll onto the site. They ha armor plates that extend the length of the vehicle attach sides with hydraulic arms. Three barricade one side of th and the other three the opposing side. The hydraulic arms the armored plates to the ground with a thud. A back door open forming a ramp and simultaneously SCU TROOPERS hustl the transports and take cover behind the plates. The TROO dressed in SWAT/Military black uniforms with a large whit insignia and various technical modifications (radios, hel goggles). Leading them is SCU Commander CAPTAIN MAGGIE SAWYER along DAN TURPIN (her second in command). They are also dressed black fatigues. SAWYER has short brown hair and a lack of femininity. TURPIN is a gruff, seasoned veteran of the fo his late 40s. TROOPER #1 (To SAWYER over the noise) Sir, ground force is in place and air support is standing by!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVERHEAD, BLACK METROPOLIS SCU HELICOPTERS fly overhead a above the tenements as SCU TROOPERS repel to the rooftops their weapons strapped to their backs, they scurry into p overlooking the street. TROOPER #1 The eye in the sky is armed and ready, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In MEGAPHONE) METALLO! You're surrounded! Throw down your weapons and step into the open!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO looks around him and holds his arms out. METALLO You see any weapons?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, he did all that by himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To METALLO) Surrender, Metallo! You don't have a chance! METALLO Then come and get me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To METALLO) This is your last chance! I am counting to three! (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO picks up a motorcycle and hurls it through the ai SAWYER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INCOMING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TROOPERS scatter for their lives. The cycle crashes into VEHICLE and EXPLODES. METALLO (To himself) Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In radio) GROUND TROOPS! OPEN FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TROOPERS pop up from behind their cover and begin a nonst barrage of bullet fire that doesn't phase him. He starts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't droppin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several grenades are thrown and explode around him. He ca one and it explodes in his fist. METALLO walks to the bar TROOPERS fire furiously at him as he grabs one and lifts the four foot barricade, tossing the TROOPER into the mid the street. METALLO pushes the barricade over and several TROOPERS run but one is caught under its falling weight. FIRE TROOPER comes with a flame thrower. FIRE TROOPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO turns as the fire blast engulfs him. The sixty fo makes visibility almost zero. METALLO appears through the and crimps the flame thrower nozzle causing the fire to d inside. The fuel tank on FIRE TROOPER's back explodes, ki him. When METALLO emerges from the fire his flesh is burned bu causing him no pain. Parts of it don't even look attached face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie we are getting our butts handed to us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEAPONS ERUPT from all directions. METALLO picks up a rif starts shooting TROOOPERS. When his clip is empty, he sta tossing MEN with reckless abandon. Rooftop SNIPERS, frustrated, toss their guns to the side their ROCKET LAUNCHERS. ROCKETS whistle through the air e near METALLO knocking him off balance. When he falls, the TROOPERS are given hope and suddenly what seems like doze rockets are exploding around him. A rocket zooms directly at the back of his head and he tu CATCHES IT. The end is hot and there's a long exhaust tra holds it over his head and screams. The exhaust flame sto METALLO hurls the rocket back to the rooftop it came from explodes at the top of the building front causing it to b off. Huge chunks of concrete. TROOPERS at the building ed several stories to their deaths. LOIS and JIMMY are hiding and taking pictures when JIMMY with a stray bullet. He hits a wall and is knocked uncons

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frantically, LOIS tries to wake him but can't. She calls out on her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERRY WHITE is huddled around a television watching the destruction. A phone rings and RON TROUPE answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? (To PERRY) Perry, you have a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What! Ron, I got the biggest story of the year here. Tell my wife I'll call her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAWYER gets a transmission on her radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sawyer. (Beat) What? You gotta be kiddin' me! (To TURPIN) Dan, we got a problem. There are civilians trapped in the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These ten blocks were supposed to be evacuated. Who the hell's here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lois Lane and some kid from The Planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for Pete's sake. TROOPER She ain't even worth saving. She figured a way in here, she can figure a way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get her. TROOPER #1 Captain, that thing out there has already killed a half-dozen men and you want us to risk our lives for a reporter who can't follow directions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into radio) If there are any snipers available, we have civilians in the area and need a visual. (To TROOPER #1) She's coming out with us. TROOPER #1 I'm not going in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SNIPER (VO) (On radio) There is a woman and a boy about three hundred yards in from the East Side. The boy is unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TURPIN gets his gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To TROOPER) It's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On radio) Rescue underway. I need as much distraction as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TROOPERS pop up and start firing at METALLO as TURPIN run the block. Distracted, TURPIN finds LOIS and JIMMY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lois Lane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm some other idiot caught in a warzone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody likes a smart ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TURPIN tosses JIMMY across his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives LOIS his rifle and takes his handgun out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a camera. Just point and click.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine millimeter German Glock with a modified grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TURPIN gives her a surprised look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was an Army brat. I think I'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOIS takes the handgun and gives him his rifle back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They charge out into the open running for the barricade. in the lead when METALLO turns. LOIS stops and starts fir TURPIN makes it to safety. METALLO closes in on LOIS and her into the air and disarms her. METALLO I know you. You're that reporter from The Daily Planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here I didn't think you could read. METALLO Oh, you're funny, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lowers her so they're face to face. Her feet are still dangling over a foot off the ground. METALLO How about we dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOIS spits in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dance card's full. METALLO That's gonna cost you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a tapping on METALLO's shoulder. SUPERMAN (OS) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised, he turns. Behind him is SUPERMAN. SUPERMAN If the lady says she doesn't want to dance, then she doesn't want to dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN belts METALLO in the face and he drops LOIS to t street. METALLO is first shocked and then angry. SUPERMAN (Very serious) You need to get to safety, Miss Lane. This looks like a job for Superman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOIS runs to the TROOPERS who are standing by. METALLO So... you finally decided to come out and play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO charges and grabs SUPERMAN. SUPERMAN spins and us own momentum tosses METALLO across the street into a wall METALLO pushes himself out leaving an indentation. SUPERMAN Do I look like I'm playing? METALLO Fine. It's about time this got interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO rips a lightpole from the pavement and swings at SUPERMAN's whose irises turn from blue to red and a thin light sears the end of the pole off. It falls to the grou a thud. METALLO jabs the shortened pole at SUPERMAN and hits him stomach doubling him over. SUPERMAN, angry, straightens a METALLO and begins punching him about the face. He lifts his head and throws him through a building leaving a gapi In the background, the SCU UNIT cheers. Only SUPERMAN hea punch through brick in the distance. He turns and with his telescopic vision he zooms in on th building corner and again until he sees where an arm is e through the brick wall. The fist starts to move horizonta quickly tearing brick from the building. The building beg creak as the front, without lower support, starts to shif THE BUILDING SIDE collapses on superman exposing the inte the tenement. Clouds of dust are thrown into the air. The UNIT takes cover coughing. SUPERMAN is buried beneath the The dust clears and METALLO steps from inside over the ru leers at the SCU UNIT. METALLO Who's next?

dialogues.speaker: THE PAVEMENT.
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN bursts UPWARD IN A WHIRLWIND OF MOTION sending b and rubble airborne. He picks METALLO up with one hand on shoulder, the other on his leg and lifts him over his hea slams him to the ground. METALLO gets up and charges SUPERMAN tackling him to the through the pavement and into the sewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waist high in water, METALLO stands. SUPERMAN, hovering a water, blows with his freezing breath turning the sewer w ice with the moisture on the walls. SUPERMAN begins to look visibly weak. METALLO laughs. METALLO Is that the best you got? It's starting to get to you. You can't beat me. You're a dead man and you don't even know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO punches and shatters the ice freeing himself. SUP flies upward out of the sewer. METALLO climbs out after h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROFESSOR EMIL HAMILTON is processing data of a computer. background are several monitors tuned to broadcasts of th battle. The computer stops and HAMILTON has his answer. He prints results, grabs his coat and cell phone and rushes out the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGGIE SAWYER is on her radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (On radio) Are you sure? Yes, sir. (To TURPIN) Dan, Federal Emergency Management wants us to get Superman out of there and evacuate the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me. HAMILTON at STAR says if we don't get him out of there in the next five minutes he'll be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why are we leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have orders to get him and rendezvous with HAMILTON at Swan and 143rd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dandy. So who's going to go in there and get him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, SUPERMAN is getting the hell beat out SUPERMAN moves from METALLO's path and fires his HEAT VIS him. METALLO blocks the beam with his hand causing it to bright red. His hand starts to smoke and his "skin" burns off. The flames die exposing METALLO's forearm and hand As a h advanced metal skeleton hand with gears and joints. VARIO

dialogues.speaker: OF HIM HAVE BEEN EXPOSED REVEALING A MECHANICAL ROBOT INT
dialogues.text: METALLO Let's get this over with and call it a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO opens his tattered shirt exposing his metallic ch series of layers opens and SUPERMAN is basked in a bright light. Inside METALLO's chest cavity is a jagged softball chunk of KRYPTONITE, SUPERMAN's only weakness. The KRYPTO surrounded by small solar cells absorbing it's energy and powering METALLO. METALLO A lot of losers have tried to kill you but in the end I'm the only guy with the stones to do it. (Beat) How does it feel to be The Man Of Yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: A HORN BLARES.
dialogues.text: METALLO turns to get hit by an SCU RIOT VEHICLE and pushe building pinning him. A SECOND RIOT VEHICLE drives over S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, SAWYER and TURPIN open a hatch in the floor while TROOPERS stand by with pointed rifles. They pull SUPERMAN through the hatch and TURPIN slams it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VEHICLE speeds off. In the background, METALLO can be pushing the other RIOT VEHICLE on its side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAYOR BERKOWICZ is with his EMERGENCY COUNCIL when the te rings. DEPUTY MAYOR WALKER answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. BERKOWICZ I'm busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the President, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERKOWICZ has brief, unintelligible conversation. BERKOWICZ (Grief-stricken) The President has declared Metropolis a disaster area. We've been denied National Guard assistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do? BERKOWICZ He's sending someone else.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCAST
dialogues.text: An ANCHOR is reporting from a circling NEWS COPTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems in a diversionary tactic, the SCU has distracted Metallo and rescued Superman who was not faring well in the battle after a Metallo emitted a beam from- (Listing to a radio headset) --We have instructions we must evacuate the area. We will have reports for you as soon as information is available.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens of people are standing in the streets watching the newscast from a massive TIME SQUARE-LIKE JUMBOVISION. PERSON #1 The big one is just as strong as Superman. PERSON #2 Man, I wonder what they're gonna do next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It starts like a distant hum and quickly grows into a pat thumping. Three APACHE HELICOPTERS thunder overhead speeding to the PEOPLE in the street point overhead as the copters fly pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELICOPTERS maneuver between buildings. APACHE PILOT #1 (Screaming) I been wantin' to do this since I was ten! APACHE PILOT #2 Five by five, we are in the pipe. APACHE PILOT #3 This is Romeo Sierra Foxtrot. We have a targeted course of three seven nine one mark eleven twelve. Target is live. Exercise is hostile. ETA six minutes. We have been authorized to use unnecessary physical force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR is observing the TECHS scrambling to get the syste online.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of monitors comes online.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LexSats fifty-one, forty-seven, five and ninety-one are online including the Metropolis unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the Metallo system?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're working on it, sir. TECH #2 Mister Luthor, systems have picked up three Apache heliCOPters converging on Metallo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TECH #2 Six minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MERCY steps forward wearing a neck brace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mister Luthor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have a combat ready LexFlight Unit on the premises?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mister Luthor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scramble the unit and have them in the drop zone in three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large hangar-like door opens and twelve silhouettes of LEXFLIGHT TEAM are visible. CONTROL (VO) This is control. LexFlight Unit you have clearance for takeoff. LEXFLIGHT #1 Roger that. It's a go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four men run into the light wearing PURPLE and GREEN ARMO with large rifles magnetically attached to their backs). clear the building and JETS on their backs and feet IGNIT they lift off into the air. As the first four, another tw follow flying past the CAMERA stationed high above the LE building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two RIOT VEHICLES stop at a curb where PROFESSOR HAMILTON waiting in a STAR LAB van. He immediately opens the back drops a ramp and rolls out a large metal box. The RIOT VEHICLES door drops and several TROOPERS, SAWYER and SUPERMAN exit. SUPERMAN is already looking better tha moments ago, although visibly irritated. SUPERMAN HAMILTON! There are people in danger- HAMILTON I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAMILTON takes a map of Metropolis and spreads it out ove box. HAMILTON STAR Labs has satellites that monitor environmental anomalies. There have been surges of radiation exceeding acceptable levels in various locales in the metropolitan area within the last few weeks. None lasts longer than fifteen or twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you following this, Dan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was lost after "STAR Labs has satellites." SUPERMAN (Examining the map) There is nothing radioactive in these areas. HAMILTON You mean, "there should be nothing radioactive in these areas." But there is. (Beat) Every area on irradiated area on this map was a location where Metallo has made an appearance. Metallo isn't human. I'm assuming he's a machine with a human brain and enough natural elements to keep it functioning. Everything else is machine powered by nuclear radiation, which could be why he's chose Suicide Slum to make his stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Metropolis Nuclear plant is the biggest in the northeast. HAMILTON Normally, I doubt he would have been able to challenge Superman but since he's using radiation from Kryptonite as his source, Superman doesn't stand a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krypto-what? HAMILTON It's a mineral with radioactive properties that siphon Superman's abilities. Eventually his nervous system will seize and shut down his involuntary functions one at a time in rapid succession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In English, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metallo has a radioactive rock that kills Superman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why didn't he just say so. SUPERMAN I'm assuming you have a plan? HAMILTON Flips the latches on the box and opens it but the contents cannot be seen) I designed this suit for when Superman assists in deep space research. Since it's my theory that his powers are derived from our sun on a solar level, the suit is designed to keep his acquired energy in and foreign energy out. The suit is destructible. If Metallo manages to get close enough to get you out of it he can kill you. (Beat) Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEXFLIGHT TEAM swoops in over METALLO. METALLO What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twelve land forming a circle. LEXFLIGHT ONE Metallo! You are surrounded- METALLO (To himself) No shit. LEXFLIGHT ONE Surrender now and we will leave without incident. This is your last chance, Metallo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. LEXFLIGHT ONE Open fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LEXFLIGHT SQUAD opens firing. Their rifle shells crea explosions, trapping METALLO in the center. EXTREME CLOSE ON METALLO EYES TURNING GREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitors telecasting METALLO destroying the LEXFLIGHT Bodies are hurled through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO walks through the LEXFLIGHT TEAM's wasted efforts tears them out of their suits and disarms them. APACHE HELICOPTERS arrive. METALLO picks up a fallen LEXFLIGHT MEMBER and tears the from his back and drops his limp body. APACHE PILOT (VO) (Through speaker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fires at the HELICOPTER and it EXPLODES. APACHE PILOT #2 JESUS CHRIST! He just took Scala and Wahl out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He aims the rifle at another APACHE. Anticipating the bla swerve and APACHE #2 collideS with APACHE #3 and they cra a rooftop. METALLO (Yelling at the burning APACHES) Anybody else want a piece of me? Come get some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXTREME CLOSE on METALLO's face as his body jerks and he in pain and his expression goes dead. CAMERA PULLS BACK r a gloved hand that has punched through his CHEST and wrap around his exposed KRYPTONITE HEART tearing it from his b SUPERMAN, wearing a gray and white containment suit, lean his shoulder and whispers in his ear. SUPERMAN (Quietly) If you insist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

SUPERMAN Come out from behind the car, Metallo! METALLO Give me one good reason! SUPERMAN Gas tank.

They collide with the sound of thu METALLO picks SUPERMAN up and slams him into the ground repeatedly cracking the pavement. SUPERMAN makes contact with METALLO who catches him, slam into the pavement. METALLO picks SUPERMAN up and tosses h across the parking lot. SUPERMAN stands and is hit by a c at him, knocking him down again. METALLO picks up the dazed SUPERMAN and tosses him into t of a trash truck, walks around the side and throws the sw the compactor closes, the truck ROCKS BACK AND FORTH and over on METALLO pinning him underneath. Somewhere in the background LOIS witnesses it and screams.

dialogues.text: She tries to charge past the SCU to help him but is restr Slowly, SUPERMAN gets to his feet. METALLO fires again. SUPERMAN is slowed down but doesn't He fires again. SUPERMAN keeps moving toward him. METALLO in a frenzy OF gunfire. His face begins to lose its look confidence and is quickly replaced with fear. A quiet mechanical voice can barely be heard coming from LEXGUN. LEXGUN (VO) Warning. Energy... low.

dialogues.text: METALLO squeezes the trigger in disbelief and it clicks. LEXGUN (VO) Charging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLO SCREAMS a war cry, SWINGS the LEXGUN at SUPERMAN him square in the jaw. SUPERMAN doesn't flinch. METALLO hits him repeatedly with no effect. He swings aga SUPERMAN catches his fist and they lock. METALLO lifts hi hand to strike him as SUPERMAN's HEAT VISION creates a wi that METALLO's fist crosses and incinerates up to the elb SHOCKED, METALLO stares at what used to be his arm. SUPER TEARS his other arm, still gripping the LEXGUN, off at th shoulder and strikes him across the face repeatedly. The more SUPERMAN hits him, the more METALLO's loses his artificial skin revealing the chrome metal cyborg beneath Furious, SUPERMAN appears to be losing control with the m LEXGUN (VO) Charge complete. Energy levels at maximum.

dialogues.text: They both look at the gun and SUPERMAN points it (with ME arm still attached) and FIRES blasting him through the ai dropping his charred smoking carcass to the ground. His body is a complex chrome robot with a transparent shi in the skull showing a human brain. SUPERMAN stops. METALLO's eyes, a bright luminescent gree to black. SUPERMAN is out of breath and wobbles away from chrome cyborg left among the rubble.

dialogues.text: LUTHOR is standing proud among the nervous TECHS. The mon are all lit and the system is operational.

dialogues.text: HAMILTON, SAWYER and TURPIN to come SUPERMAN's aid. SUPERMAN (Remorseful) I murdered him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was gonna do you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAMILTON checks the cyborg with some equipment. HAMILTON He's still alive. I'm detecting brain waves. His mechanical body isn't functioning but his brain is operating. You didn't kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To SUPERMAN) You hear that? You broke him.

dialogues.text: SAWYER gets a call on her radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To SUPERMAN) Superman, the MAYOR wants to speak to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SECURITY sees them coming. SECURITY Sir, I'm sorry there are no-

dialogues.text: They walk past her and SUPERMAN throws the massive doors Inside, LUTHOR is seated behind his giant desk in a virtu empty room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe the girl outside said I wasn't in. BERKOWICZ (Angry) You've gone too far this time, Lex. There are six dead pilots and I don't even know how many other wounded because of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Frank, I'm sorry. BERKOWICZ Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERKOWICZ charges LUTHOR and SUPERMAN stops him. BERKOWICZ Tell their families you're sorry! Those men wouldn't be dead if your incompetent men didn't hand Metallo those weapons! For Christ's sake, Lex, you gave him a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I say? (Looking directly at SUPERMAN) I underestimated my enemy. BERKOWICZ Mark my words, Lex: You are not going to get away with this. I swear you'll see justice or-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Annoyed) Or what? What, Frank? You're going to shut me down? Sue me? Send me to jail. Can't you see I'm not playing a game here? I picked up the ball when you and your boys dropped it and I did what needed to be done! Who was going to save us, Frank? Your toy soldiers? The military? You see what he did to them. Where was your precious Superman? He had abandoned you, Frank? Ask him where he was. I did what I had to to protect what was in my best interest and that is to make sure this city is under control and guarantee I'm the man behind those controls. (Beat) So I made a bad call. It happens. BERKOWICZ This isn't your city, Luthor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! I am worth one hundred and sixteen billion dollars! I buy and sell people and their ideals the way most people order lunch! Governors, attorneys, police and MAYORs! Everyone in this city works for me directly or indirectly whether they know it or not! This city is Metropolis because I made it Metropolis. Without me it's nothing! Just another decaying urban wasteland and you know it! You even think about crossing me I'll have my lawyers wrap you in red tape from here to Kingdom Come! (Calmer) You remember this: You aren't the first MAYOR this city has ever had and God knows you aren't the first idealist. There will be another election in November and you might be sitting in your quaint little office in City Hall and you might not be. I, however, know exactly where I'll be sitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR goes behind his desk and comfortably eases into hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now gentlemen, if you'll excuse me, I have an empire to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a very long silence. BERKOWICZ Superman... SUPERMAN Yes, your honor. BERKOWICZ Under the power granted to me by the city of Metropolis I am deputizing you. (Beat) Arrest this man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR has an expression few people see. Shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look up.

dialogues.speaker: IMAGE OF LUTHOR STANDING AGAINST A WALL.
dialogues.text: LUTHOR looks up. LUTHOR's tie is undone and he's fuming w anger. In front of him is a plate with: "LUTHOR, ALEXANDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Trying not to laugh) Name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR is placed into the holding tank with the other rif

dialogues.text: LUTHOR is met by MERCY. They exit the station swarmed by reporters. LOIS LANE is among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR enters and gets himself a drink. As he walks past window, SUPERMAN is floating outside waiting for him with arms folded. LUTHOR takes a remote control from the desk and opens the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd invite you in for a drink but you don't seem like the drinking type... even though a stiff drink would probably do you some good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a pretty smart fellow so you probably know your recent failings were no fault of your own. It's really simple: For enough money you can get anyone to sabotage a monorail or school bus and push it on some train tracks. Then you plant your man in a the site of the predetermined disaster he averts. He smiles for the cameras and looks fantastic. On the other hand, it doesn't exactly make you look like the spit and polish hero everybody loves so much. The whole reason I created Metallo was to falter the public's faith in its power source. Make them feel unsafe and then I would come along and sell them something safer. Something more advanced. Something more, how should I say, expensive and I make a few billion dollars in the process and replace you with my own "Man Of Steel." One that I hold the strings to and take you out of my misery at the same time. Absolutely brilliant. I don't know who you are or where you come from or why you're here but what I do know is I don't like to be shown up my city. Don't think you can come in here with your fancy pants, good looks and that truth, justice, blah blah blah and that from me. I can live with the heroics and I can even live knowing there may be one person in Metropolis I can't influence but you embarrassed me in front of my town and that will not be forgotten. When your number is up, I'll be the one holding the ticket. That I promise you. (Beat) Now, you tell me... am I telling the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arms folded, SUPERMAN's expression is stern blankness. SUPERMAN I'm watching you, Luthor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERMAN flies straight up. LUTHOR looks out the window a gone. When he's gone, LUTHOR reaches inside his jacket and bene shirt and retrieves a small pager size box. On the front pulsing light. He presses the intercom.

dialogues.text: Miss Teshmacher. secretary (VO) Yes, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the boys in R and D it works. They'll see my appreciation for the efforts in next week's check. SECRETARY (VO) Right away, Mister Luthor.

ANGELA (VO) This morning, sources at Interpol and the Central Intelligence Agency have confirmed internet speculation that Metallo's true identity is that of John Corben, a known mercenary and thief wanted worldwide for crimes neither agency would elaborate on. How the human Corben became the superhuman Metallo, is still a mystery. MAYOR Berkowicz has this to say: BERKOWICZ (VO) It has been a difficult few days for us all. The loss of life cannot be replaced. We have suffered many tragedies and avoided more but today we are safe. Wherever you are, thank you Superman. ANGELA (VO) This is Angela Chen. Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat) You never get tired of this do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: I'm glad your home, Clark.

dialogues.text: Several SCIENTISTS are working on various projects. LUTHO and approaches the lead scientist, DR WENG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My time is valuable, Doctor Weng.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I will not abuse it. I thought you'd be interested in our progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm always interested in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENG leads LUTHOR to a glass tube filled with liquid. Ins what's left of METALLO being kept alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the Metallo body was a prototype, we were able to salvage the main processors and reflex circuitry. The brain still functions well... surprisingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the equipment. That costs money. You can toss the brain. I'll find another one. (Beat) And the Police...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will have the useless replica we designed to replace this one and will be none the wiser. (Beat) It still puzzles me how you managed to retrieve this one from a secured Police facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotham has some of the best thieves in the world if you can find them. Pay them enough money and they can get you anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have also made great strides with the cloning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last was orangutan. Fully mobile and intelligent. She lived for three days. Seventeen hours longer than the previous one. It was quite marvelous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do fantastic work, Weng.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am glad you're satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR shakes his hand and leaves. As he is leaving he tu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weng...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mister Luthor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On second thought, keep the brain. I'll find some use for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Mister Luthor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUTHOR leaves.
